intro: Euphrasia stricta var. slovaca, commonly known as the Slovak eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in whorls along the stems. Euphrasia stricta var. slovaca is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
